note.p: Education: Trinity College, Oxford; BA (1703), MA (1706), MB (1709), MD (1713)
Career: Fellow of St Peter's College, Oxford (1728-1731); Physician to St Bartholomew's Hospital, London (1750); died of 'a dead palsy'
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Foster; Venn (son's entry); Munk
Notes: Proposed by James Jurin; Sir Hans Sloane. DNB confuses him with his son who was at Emmanuel College, Cambridge (matriculated 1731)
